titleStmt.title: Board of Trustees of the Town of Somerset, Order
CWG7882

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: At a called meetinig of the Board of Trustees of the Town of Somerset held at their room on Saturday the 31st day of January 1863 the following order was entered of record --

William A. Sallee Police Judge of the Town of Somerset having informed the Board that he had sent his resignation to his Excellency James F Robinson Governor of Ky to take effect on the 4th day of February 1863, It is ordered by the Board that James W. Wilson be recommended by the said Board to the Governor of Ky. as a fsuitable person, to be by him commissioned Police Judge of the Town of Somerset to supply the vacancy of said Sallee

Per order of Board of Trustees of the Town of Somerset
a copy att a Tidball Millen Clerk
Make appt according to within recommendation

J. W. Wilson
Com Issd Feby 5. 1863
